moves.1. e4: Hey guys. This has been my 4th game against my coach, dan. And I have a feeling I might have this one in the bag. Of course, I'm only on move 35, so lots could still change. But I like how even of a challenge he is for me. Hope this one's my best
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 d6 3. Bb5+ c6: This is my favorite form without the knights. It might look weird, but it helps later
moves.4. Ba4 g6 5. d4: Capturing would get his queen to the action, and attack my rook. So I try another alternative-Be7
moves.5... Be7: Now most of you would think, then g6 is a wasted move. I completely agree with you
moves.6. d5: he pins me, but nothing serious
moves.6... Bd7 7. Be3: Here I try a tricky combination of moves, hoping for the best out of this position-
moves.9. Nxa4: Nxa4, following up with Qa5+, getting into the action
moves.9... Qa5+: now he has 2 options here-C3, or nc3. I say best is nc3, but he tries an alternative
moves.10. c3: Tricky- a protecter for the knight
moves.11. b4: He still leaves a helpless little pawn for me to kill
moves.11... Qxd5 12. Qxd5: I want your opinions on this- which side do you think is better after nxd5? I say black. It's area is way more secure. And better for castling
moves.12... Nxd5 13. Bh6 Nf4: I wanted to give him some bait to get off h6. I wanted to castle
moves.14. Bxf4 exf4: leaving a partly open file to take advantage of after I castle
moves.15. Nf3 O-O 16. O-O: Line-in-line rooks will help me in this kind of a position, especially when he can pin me on the open file, so i need backup by moving my knight
moves.16... Nd7 17. Rfe1 Bf6: pinning the pawn, or atleast freezing the knight will help
moves.18. Rad1 Be5: here I was planning NxE5, NxE5, RxD6, F3, G2xF3, NxF3, KF1, NxE1
moves.19. Nxe5 Nxe5: things have went well so far...
moves.20. Rxd6: but not for long. I had dropped a pawn along the way
moves.21... f3: no matter the outcome here, the trade favored black
moves.22... Nc4: There I was puting on a seccond attack, Hoping he would move his D6 rook instead. Oh, yes. He played it. But safe- Rdd1
moves.23. Rdd1 Rxe1+ 24. Rxe1: Iv'e come into alot of even games against this guy. But I end up losing them all because I'm not the best at endgame. It's even again. I hope I can pull something off-
moves.24... h5 25. Re4 b5 26. Nc5 Rd8 27. Re1: I had a game against the same guy just 3 weeks ago were it came down to a rook and knight vs. a rook and knight. I lost, but it was all because of his well played rook. Why not make the same mistake again-
moves.28. Kh2 Re8: now here I obviously made a terrible mistake. I was afraid of him having a rook so I just wanted to trade them off. He probably could have responded nd7+, and that would ruin everything. I suppose coach just went easy on me
moves.33. Kxg2 Ne3+ 34. Kf3 Nxg4 35. a4 bxa4: Now is where I left off. I'm a pawn ahead. Who do you think will win?
moves.36. Nxa4 Ke7 37. Ke4 g5 38. hxg5: I tried trapping his pawn so I could also go for promotion. That plan failed after an upcoming move that cost me the game- f6
moves.38... h4 39. Kf3 h3 40. Kg3 h2 41. Kg2 K: I was planning to get his pawn, but he senced me off to a different plan after HE went for promotion
moves.42. c4 Kd6 43. c5+ Kc6 44. Nc3 f6: Here came the losing move- F6. I knew the instant from move 45 it was a dead game
moves.45. g6 f5 46. g7 Nh6 47. Kxh2 f4 48. Kg2: my plan here was way off topic. But with 2 threats of promotion, I came from a good game to a bad game.
moves.50. Kf3 Kc6 51. a6 Kb6 52. a7 Kxa7 53. K: here  I was about to resighn. My hopes were lost even at only -1 points. This position was everything
moves.53... Kb7 54. Kg5 Nf7+: A HUGE screw up. Ng8 is MUCH better. Little mistakes like that in this type of a position mean everything. Now, after Kg6 I will probably resighn- lose my 4th game against him
